settings.label: General Information
settings.description: This tab allows you to fill in the general data about your module

namespace.label: Namespace
namespace.tooltip: This is the folder name of your new extension. Your company name should go here. Use only letters and numbers. Start with a capital letter.

module_name.label: Module name
module_name.tooltip:
This is your extension/module name. It should be something meaningful and not very long.
Try to use a noun in singular form. Start with a capital letter.
module_name.additional: For security reasons, to avoid module name collisions with the Magento core you cannot name a module just like an existing one even in a different namespace: "Catalog", "Sales", "Checkout"...

codepool.label: Code pool
codepool.tooltip: This is the code folder in which your extension will be installed. If you don't know what goes here, choose "local"

install.label: Action
install.tooltip: This allows you to directly install the module you create on the current Magento instance, or create a zip with it and install it later.
install.additional:
Warning:The zip is not compatible with Magento Connect. It's just a simple archive with the files of the module.
If you choose to install the module directly no file will be overwritten. If by a human error or UMC error a file should be overwritten then the 'Action' is changed to 'Create an archive. I will install it later.' and you will be notified of the files that were not overwritten.

version.label: Version
version.tooltip: This is the version of the module.

menu_text.label: Menu title
menu_text.tooltip: This is the title that will be added to the menu.

menu_parent.label: Parent menu ID
menu_parent.tooltip: This is the parent menu id of the module menu. Leave empty to add in top menu.

sort_order.label: Menu sort order
sort_order.tooltip: This is the sort order in the menu.

license.label: License
license.tooltip:
The text you put here will be added at the top of (almost) each file in the module you create.
Use {{Namespace}} as a placeholder for namespace, {{Module}} as a placeholder for the module name and {{Y}} as placeholder for current year.
If you don't want any License text on your files just leave this field empty.

name.label: Name settings
name.description: Settings regarding the entity name and code

label_singular.label: Label singular
label_singular.tooltip:
Each entity must have a label used for buttons, links, messages.
This is the singular form of the label. For example in a blog module, the post entity will have the label in singular form 'Post'
label_singular.additional:
Info:Try to use English words for this label. It's not mandatory, but it makes the taxonomy more readable. UMC will create a language file for the modules it generates and you can translate your module.
Info:I recommend the first letter to be uppercase.

label_plural.label: Label plural
label_plural.tooltip: This is the plural form of the label above. It will be used for lists. (For example: 'Posts')
label_plural.additional:
Info:Try to use English words for this label. It's not mandatory, but it makes the taxonomy more readable. UMC will create a language file for the modules it generates and you can translate your module.
Info:I recommend the first letter to be uppercase.

name_singular.label: Entity code singular
name_singular.tooltip:
UMC generates the code in a 'human readable' form. It's easier to figure out what the code is about when the variables and methods have a propper name.
For example it's easier to read foreach ($_posts as $_post){...} or $_post->getTags() than foreach ($_list as $_item){...} or $_entity->getRelated('tags');
The value you fill in here will be used for variable names, file names and table names.
name_singular.additional:
Info:Use only letters. No numbers, no underscores, all in lowercase.
Info::There are some restrictions to these values, because there are reserved strings that might make the code not function properly. For example: 'resource', 'setup'. For a complete list of restrictions see Ultimate_ModuleCreator_Helper_Data::$_restrictedEntityNames

name_plural.label: Entity code plural
name_plural.tooltip: This is the plural value of the entity code. For example 'posts'.
name_plural.additional: Info:Use only letters. No numbers, no underscores, all in lowercase.

type.label: Entity type
type.tooltip: There are 2 types of entities in Magento EAV and Flat (all fields in one table). Choose yours

is_tree.label: Behaves as tree
is_tree.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes' then your entity will behave as the default Magento categories. It will have the same UI as the categories module have. The fields 'parent_id', 'position' 'children_count' & 'level' will be added automatically to the entity.

store.label: Enable by stores
store.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes' it will allow you to assign your entity to specific store views (just like pages or static block).

add_created_to_grid.label: Add "Created at" to admin grid
add_created_to_grid.tooltip:
The entities created with UMC will have a field called 'created_at' with the creation date of any entity instance.
If this is set to 'Yes' the 'Created at' field will be added to the admin grid.

add_updated_to_grid.label: Add "Updated at" to admin grid
add_updated_to_grid.tooltip:
The entities created with UMC will have a field called 'updated_at' with the last update date of any entity instance.
If this is set to 'Yes' the 'Updated at' field will be added to the admin grid.

search.label: Include in admin global search
search.tooltip:
The Magento admin Global search (at the top of every admin page) searches for the text you enter in products, customers and orders.
If you set this to 'Yes' than it will search in your entity also.

api.label: Create API
api.tooltip:
Magento offers a SOAP API for managing products, categories, orders and other entities.
If this is set to 'Yes', then your entity will also be available for managing through the SOAP API.
It generates the classes and xml files needed for API V1, API V2 and API V2 with WSI compliance.

create_frontend.label: Create frontend files
create_frontend.tooltip:
If this is set to 'Yes' then the frontend files of your entity will be created.
If this is set to 'No', all the other fields in this section will not be available.

create_list.label: Create entity list files
create_list.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', a link will be added to the footer to a page where your entity instances will be listed. The page has a toolbar for pagination, and it will list the titles of the entity instances.

list_template.label: List page template
list_template.tooltip: From this dropdown you can select the layout of your entity list page from the available page formats.
list_template.additional:
All the Magento page layouts are listed here: 1column, 2columns-left, ....
If you have any other page layout it will appear here.

create_view.label: Create entity view files
create_view.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', the files needed for the page details of your entity are created.

view_template.label: View page template
view_template.tooltip: From this dropdown you can select the layout of your entity view page from the available page formats.
view_template.additional:
All the Magento page layouts are listed here: 1column, 2columns-left, ....
If you have any other page layout it will appear here.

add_seo.label: Add SEO attributes
add_seo.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', 3 extra fields/attributes will be added to your entity, 'meta_title', 'meta_keywords' and 'meta_description'. The values of these fields/attributes will be added used for the details page of your entity.

url_rewrite.label: Create URL rewrites
url_rewrite.tooltip:
If you set this to 'Yes', a new field will be added to your entity called 'url_key'.
This will allow you to use SEF url's for your entity view pages. Example: http://mysite.com/some-key-here.html
url_rewrite.additional:
If is set to 'No' your entity view page will be accessed in the default way http://mysite.com/module/controller/action/id/7
warningThis field is available only if 'Create entity view page' is set to 'Yes'.

url_prefix.label: URL prefix
url_prefix.tooltip: This is the prefix of your url. Example 'news', 'articles'. Leave empty for no prefix.

url_suffix.label: URL suffix
url_suffix.tooltip: This is the suffix of your url. Example 'html', 'htm'. Don't add the dot. Leave empty for no suffix.

rss.label: Create RSS feed
rss.tooltip:
If this is set to 'Yes', a RSS feed with your entities will be added to the list or Magento RSS feeds.
Also a new fields called 'in_rss' will be added to your entity. This will allow you to filter the entities listed in the RSS feed.
You can disable the RSS feature later from the configuration section of your module.
rss.additional: Known issue:If all the default Magento RSS feeds are disabled, but the general RSS feed is enabled and the RSS feed for your entity is also enabled a message will apprear on the RSS list page: 'There are no Rss Feeds'. This happens because Magento RSS list functionality does not allow adding custom RSS feeds without overriding a block.

widget.label: Create widgets
widget.tooltip:
If this is set to 'Yes', 2 new widgets will be added to the list of widgets that can be used in CMS pages and CMS blocks.
One widget will allow you to add a link to your entity instance and one will allow you to add a few details about your entity in CMS page or block.

allow_comment.label: Allow comments
allow_comment.tooltip:
If this is set to 'Yes' the users of your website will be able to comment on your custom entities. Comments will be moderated.
warning:This option is available only if "Create frontend view" is set to 'Yes'.

manage_comment.label: Enable/disable comments for each instance
manage_comment.tooltip:
This setting will add a new attribute/field that will allow you to enable/disable the comment form for each entity instance.
warning:This option is available only if "Allow comments" is set to 'Yes'.

link_product.label: Link "many to many" with products
link_product.tooltip:
If this is set to 'Yes', a new tab will be added to the product add/edit form, with a list of your entities. Something similar to the 'Related products' tab.
Also on your entity add/edit page a similar tab listing all the products will be added.

show_on_product.label: Show associated entities on product page
show_on_product.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', a new section with the list of your entities related to a specific product will be added to the product view page.
show_on_product.additional:
This happens for the default Magento theme and for themes with similar format for the product view page. For custom themes there the block might not appear.
Info: This field is available only if 'Link "many to many" with products' is set to 'Yes'.

show_products.label: Show associated product on entity page
show_products.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', a new section with the list of your products related to one entity will be added to the entity view page.
show_products.additional: Info: This field is available only if 'Link "many to many" with products' is set to 'Yes'.

product_attribute.label: Make entity a product attribute
product_attribute.tooltip: This will add a new dropdown attribute to the product where the options will be your entity instances.

product_attribute_code.label: Product attribute code
product_attribute_code.tooltip: Fill in the dropdown attribute code.

product_attribute_group.label: Product attribute group
product_attribute_group.tooltip: The name of the attribute group where the attribute will be added. If you leave it empty the attribute will not be added to the attribute sets. If the group does not exist it will be created.

link_category.label: Link "many to many" with category
link_category.tooltip:
If this is set to 'Yes', a new tab will be added to the category add/edit form, with a list of your entities. Something similar to the 'Products' tab.
Also on your entity add/edit page a similar tab listing all the categories will be added.

show_on_category.label: Show associated entities on category page
show_on_category.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', a new section with the list of your entities related to a specific category will be added to the category view page.

show_category.label: Show associated categories on entity page
show_category.tooltip: If this is set to 'Yes', a new section with the list of your categories related to one entity will be added to the entity view page.
show_category.additional: Info: This field is available only if 'Link "many to many" with categories' is set to 'Yes'.

category_attribute.label: Make entity a category attribute
category_attribute.tooltip: This will add a new dropdown attribute to the category where the options will be your entity instances.

category_attribute_code.label: Category attribute code
category_attribute_code.tooltip: Fill in the dropdown attribute code.

category_attribute_group.label: Category attribute group
category_attribute_group.tooltip: The name of the attribute group where the attribute will be added. If you leave it empty the attribute will not be added to the category attribute set. If the group does not exist it will be created.

fieldset.label: Field / Attribute settings
fieldset.description: Configure the field / attribute assigned to the entity

code.label: Attribute code
code.tooltip:
This is the attribute code. It will be used in the logic of the extension. Use only letters (a-z), numbers (0-9) or underscore(_) in this field, first character should be a letter.
There are some naming restriction. For example the code cannot be: "data", "child

label.label: Attribute label
label.tooltip: This is the attribute label that will be visible in the back-end in the add/edit form and in some cases in frontend.

type.label: Attribute Type
type.tooltip: This is the attribute type. This wil determine the table column type for this field/attribute and its behavior.

scope.label: Attribute Scope
scope.tooltip: This is the attribute scope. It is available only for EAV entities. It works similar to the product attribute scope.

note.label: Note
note.tooltip: This will be added as a comment under the field in the admin add/edit form.

position.label: Position
position.tooltip: This is the sort order of the field in the add/edit form.

is_name.label: Acts as name
is_name.tooltip: Each entity must have an attribute to behave as "Name". This attribute will be used to identify different entities among themselves. It will also be used in dropdowns with entities. This option is available only for text, number and decimal attributes.

required.label: Required
required.tooltip: This sets the attribute as required in the admin add/edit form. Is available for all the attribute types.

editor.label: Use WYSIWYG editor
editor.tooltip: This allows you to use a WYSIWYG editor for the attribute. It is available only for Textarea attributes.

admin_grid.label: Show in admin grid
admin_grid.depend_class: type-text type-yesno type-timestamp type-int type-decimal type-website type-dropdown type-country
admin_grid.tooltip: This allows you to display the attribute as a column in the admin grid of the entity. The attribute set to behave as "Name" will be included by default in the grid.

frontend.label: Show in frontend
frontend.tooltip: This allows you to show the attribute in the entity view page. Is available for all attribute types.

widget.label: Show in widget
widget.tooltip: This allows you to show the attribute in view widget. Is available for all attribute types.

rss.label: Show in rss
rss.tooltip: This allows you to show the attribute in rss feed. Is available for all attribute types.

options_source.label: Options source
options_source.tooltip: For dropdown and multiselect attributes you can set the values manually or use the values from a product attribute, a category attribute or a customer attribute.

options_source_attribute.label: Attribute code for option source
options_source_attribute.tooltip: If you choose to use teh values of an attribute as values for the dropdown field enter here the attribute code to use. If the product (or category or customer) attribute does not have values or does not support values you will not see any options.

options.label: Options in select
options.tooltip: If you choose to enter the values for the dropdown or multiselect manually, input them here. Separate the options with | (pipe). If you want an empty option at the begining start with a | (pipe) symbol.

none.label: --Has no relation with--
none.description: The entities are not related in any way.

parent.label: Is parent for
parent.description:
The first entity acts as a parent for the second one
. A field will be added to the second entity table as a reference to the first entity.

child.label: Is child of
child.description:
The first entity acts as a child for the second one
. A field will be added to the first entity table as a reference to the first entity.

sibling.label: Is sibling with
sibling.description: The entities are in a many to many relation. A new table will be created to support this relation containing the ids of each entity.

created_at.message: An attribute/field with code "created_at" will be added by default to your entity.

updated_at.message: An attribute/field with code "updated_at" will be added by default to your entity.

status.message: An attribute/field with code "status" will be added by default to your entity if you choose to create frontend files for the entity.

in_rss.message: An attribute/field with code "in_rss" will be added by default to your entity if you choose to create a RSS feed for the entity.

meta_title.message: An attribute/field with code "meta_title" will be added by default to your entity if you choose to add seo attributes to the entity.

meta_description.message: An attribute/field with code "meta_description" will be added by default to your entity if you choose to add seo attributes to the entity.

meta_keywords.message: An attribute/field with code "meta_keywords" will be added by default to your entity if you choose to add seo attributes to the entity.

parent_id.message: A field with the code "parent_id" will be added by default to your entity if the entity has "Tree behavior"

level.message: A field with the code "level" will be added by default to your entity if the entity has "Tree behavior"

children_count.message: A field with the code "children_count" will be added by default to your entity if the entity has "Tree behavior"

path.message: A field with the code "path" will be added by default to your entity if the entity has "Tree behavior"

url_key.message: A attribute/field with the code "url_key" will be added by default to your entity oif you choose to create URL rewrites for your entity

node.message: A field/attribute cannot have the code "node"

attribute_codes.label: Refactored some attribute codes
attribute_codes.comment: Variables that depend on attribute names now look like this: $someName instead of $some_name

front_layout.label: Frontend layout file generation
front_layout.comment: Frontend layout file was always generated. Now is generated only if there is at least one entity that has frontend.

dropdown.label: Fixed dropdown attributes for flat entities
dropdown.comment: Dropdown attribute for flat entities were not configured correctly in the admin grid and admin add/edid form.

product_relation.label: Entities not displaying in product page.
product_relation.comment: Entities were not displaying in product page unless they had a separate view page.

validation.label: Fixed field/attribute codes validation.
validation.comment: Field/Attribute codes use the same validation as product attributes

eav_entities.label: Added EAV entities
eav_entities.comment: Now you can create EAV entities that you can manage just like products and categories.

category_link.label: Added many to many link to categories
category_link.comment: Now you can link you entities "many to many" with the catalog categories

comments.label: Added comment feature
comments.comment: You can choose to allow customers to write comments on your entities.

extensible.label: Made extension "extensible"
extensible.comment: Yeah...like someone is going to extend it

tree_many.label: Many to many relations between tree entities
tree_many.comment: Now the tree entities can be related in "Many to many"

menu_placing.label: Module menu can be placed anywhere
menu_placing.comment: Until now the menu could be placed in admin only on top level. Now it can be placed anywhere in the menu tree.

attribute_types.label: Added new attribute types
attribute_types.comment: dorpdown, multiselect. Can have different sources - still experimental.

attribute_entity.label: Custom entities can be added as product, category and customer attributes.

version.label: You can set the version of your generated module.

source_refactor.label: Source file refactoring
source_refactor.comment: Because some IDEs show errors when parsing incomplete PHP files I've removed the extension of the source files (etc/source)

js_refactor.label: Refactored JS
js_refactor.comment: The UI of the module creator now uses prototype classes instead of simple JS functions.

ui_refactor.label: UI refactor
ui_refactor.comment: 'Pimped up' the UI of the module creator

theme.label: Removed frontend package and theme fields
theme.comment: base/default is used for all modules.

identation.label: Changed identation from TAB to 4x space

speed.label: Improved speed of the module creator
speed.comment: No more AJAX calls to add an entity/attribute. The module save is done in the same step as validation.

uninstall.label: Module creator generate sql uninstall script
uninstall.comment: Along with the list of generated files now an sql uninstall script is generated for the created module.

ucwords.label: Fixed bug that appears when there is an uppercase letter in the module name.
ucwords.comment: In previous version 'ModuleName' was not working on UNIX servers. Only 'Modulename'. This is fixed in this version.

carco.for: Thanks for the abstract image helper implementation.

magepsycho.for: Thanks for the free testing and the good ideas.
